What did Christmas smell like? What did he smell like?  “Fuck, hold on, babe, I’m sorry, I have to take you home.  Can we do that?  Can we go home?”

          “Yeah, yeah,” you mumbled, not caring about anything but finding his scent.  Perhaps it was buried underneath his shirt or underneath his skin.  Perhaps if you just searched all over him, you would find it.

          “Y/N, hold on,” he said gently as he took a giant breath, the air running over your neck as it rushed into his mouth.  The kiss he placed on your neck was probably meant to calm you down, to be some promise of more to come, but it only made you cling to him tighter as he tried to pull away.  “I’m sorry, I’m sorry,” he mumbled, running his fingers through your hair and placing his hands over yours.  “I-we-have to pack up my stuff, then we can go.  Okay?”

          “Please?” you said to him, or to his scent, or to the universe, desperate for him to not let go.

          “Okay, okay,” he said, his hand on your back as his head moved back and forth as he thought.  You hadn’t let go of him, and you really didn’t plan to, even as he managed to pull out his phone and call someone, the low drone of someone on the other end unrecognizable to you and unappealing.  You barely registered what Yoongi was saying, though you did notice the way he stuttered and sucked in a breath when you finally, finally started to mouth at his neck.

          He didn’t taste like anything, not really, which you knew was a mistake, which you knew was wrong.  Except it wasn’t, really.  You were the mistake.  You were wrong.  You knew he smelled like something—what does Christmas smell like?—and you knew he must therefore taste like something—Christmas? Like those candy canes? Fruit cake? What did people eat at Christmas?—but it was nothing, there was nothing, just smooth, warm skin that you were determined to find something in.

          “Y/N,” Yoongi’s voice brought you a back a little, though you still didn’t leave his neck alone until he pulled on your ear lightly but enough for you to blink and let go of him until his hands cupped your face and brought it front of his own.  “You with me?”

          “I want to smell you,” you said, barely aware of the tears covering your face.  “I-I want to do all that.”

          “I know, babe, me too.  Let’s go home and we can do whatever want, okay?”

          “Okay,” you said shakily, because it wasn’t quite okay. You were sure you could do everything and anything you wanted with and to him, but you couldn’t smell him, and you weren’t sure if anything else was going to be enough.  “Okay,” you nodded again, though, because you had to let go of him so you could walk, and you panicked for a moment that he was going to take you back into the main room where everyone would see how much of a mess you had suddenly become, though in reality it had been building up for hours or days or years, but he dragged you right past the hall, the music temporarily becoming louder as you passed the open doors.

          “Stay here for just a second?” he said gently, placing you against a wall and waiting for you to nod before he let go.  You did not count the seconds he was gone, but he was back in a flash with nothing but yours and his coat.  He helped you into yours before putting his own on before sticking his hand out to you that you took gratefully.  You end up clinging to his entire arm, but he didn’t seem to mind.

          “Your equipment?” you said as he walked you outside, but he simply shrugged.

          “Called Seihoon, one of my sound techs.  He’ll come pack it all up.”

          “Are you sure?”

          “I’m the boss.  Of course I’m sure.  I ignored you for long enough.”

          “You didn’t.  You weren’t, really.  I think, no, I know, if I really needed you, you would have been by me in a heartbeat. You were watching out for me.  I was just wallowing a bit.  I didn’t feel ignored, just a little needy.”

          “It’s okay to be needy.  I’ll give you whatever you need,” Yoongi said assuredly, raising the hand he was holding to his mouth to kiss along your knuckles.  You merely nodded, because you believed him.  You just knew, based on what he was saying and based on his past actions, that he was telling the truth.  

          But you also knew that he could never give you what you felt like you really needed.  Still, you climbed in the car after him and sat as close to him as possible, because if you couldn’t smell him, you would take whatever else you could get, and the quiet that fell as you drove home, the urge and desperation fading into something more like contentment and peace, was almost enough because you shared it with him.


           Seokjin knew he was difficult.  Not necessarily difficult to please.  Just. Difficult.  He was a child in an adult’s body, Yoongi once said, and he had meant it as an insult.  Seokjin was easily upset and riled up.  He was defiant sometimes to the point of being bratty.  He was picky and liked things to be done a certain way.  He had gained a lot of real confidence, not just faking it when he felt insecure, over the years and was willing to fight anyone who tried to argue with him.

           But he was also extremely polite and respectful.  All of his staff had always said so.  He had worked with countless of other actors and singers and models by this point in his career, and they always all agreed he had a humility like no other. He was selfless and thought of others, always wanting to make sure they were fed and taken care of.  He listened to the concern of all his employees, even down to the janitors, so he knew he wasn’t all bad.

           So he was humble enough to know that Y/N may have been right about needing to apologize to Yoongi, but stubborn enough to know that Yoongi wasn’t completely innocent; it took two people to be in a relationship, two people to create conflict, two people to not resolve things, two people to want to try again.

           But it was bothering him.  It bothered him, for some unknown reason he couldn’t wrap his head around, to see Yoongi so happy.  He had no reason to be jealous; nothing about Namjoon ever left him unsatisfied. Seokjin may be hard to please, but Namjoon did nothing but please him.  He felt a little faulty, though, like a soulmate gone wrong, when he felt a twinge of remorse.  Some odd feeling of knowing he and Yoongi had been happy together for a while slipping away. He wondered if they had ever been happy, or if it had merely been a pre-courser, some fake form of happiness that wouldn’t quite do in the long run, that they both knew wouldn’t last but was only getting them ready for the real deal.  And when Seokjin had found the real deal in Namjoon, Yoongi had had to wait for years until Y/N came along, and Seokjin had to watch him suffer and hurt and push people away for all that time.  So he wasn’t jealous, and he knows he doesn’t regret what happened, because it brought him to Namjoon, but he was sad.  Sad that it took so long for Yoongi to finally be as happy as Seokjin has been for years now.  He knows Yoongi’s been happy, as his music makes him extremely so like nothing else can, but it all seems pale in comparison to how he looks now.  He never got to see Yoongi look like that, and he knows it’s no fault of his own.  He’s not jealous.  He wasn’t. But he felt unsettled, still, and not just because Namjoon was snoring.  He was used to that.  It happened every night, after all, and couldn’t be helped by this point. Someone else might find it annoying, but it was endearing to Seokjin.  It was his white noise, a rhythm to rock him to sleep, his assurance that Namjoon was there and proof that he was sleeping soundly beside him.  He would have felt bad for waking him up as he rolled over, but he knew Namjoon wouldn’t care.  Knew he would wake up in a heartbeat if he felt like Seokjin needed him.

           “Joon.  Joon? Joonie!”  So maybe it took him a minute to wake up, and another minute to realize who was waking him up, but he still did, and even though Namjoon couldn’t hurt a crab, he looked ready to fight.

           “Wh-what?  What’s wrong?”

           “Nothing, you big baby,” Seokjin said, patting his chest so he would lie back down.

           “Why am I awake then?”  Seokjin waited until Namjoon fell back into him, his freakishly long arms and legs flopping onto him dramatically.  Seokjin let out a dramatic breath of air in return, even though he was the one who started it.

           “Do you think I’m a dick?”  The rustling and rearranging stilled as Namjoon blinked, his lashes tickling Seokjin’s skin.

           “Why are you asking that?” Namjoon said, because of course he would.  There were no simply yes or no answers with Namjoon, and even though Seokjin sighed, he appreciated it.  Namjoon made him think about everything that he did, and he wanted to explain himself to him.  Hardly ever to anyone else, but Namjoon was different.  It wasn’t even a soulmate thing; Namjoon just loved figuring people out.

           “Something Y/N said.  About me hurting Yoongi.”

           “That’s broad and vague all at the same time.  Is there something specific she said you did?”

           “She said I told Yoongi that he was lucky to date me and that I told him when we broke up that no one would ever love him.”

           “Did you say all that?”

           “I,” Seokjin mumbled, buying some time by running his hands up and down Namjoon’s arm and back, whatever parts of him he could reach.  “I don’t remember.  Does it sound like something I would say?”

           “Honestly?” Namjoon chuckled, the puffs of air tickling Seokjin.  “I’m sure you’ve said worse to him.  But most of the time you’re just messing with him. Your weird YoonJin language.”

           “YoonJin?  I haven’t heard that in a long time,” Seokjin laughed, as much as he could with Namjoon on his ribcage.

           “Your crazy fans and their crazy ship names.”

           “Don’t remind me,” Seokjin hummed.

           “But he’s always been able to tell more than you when someone’s not teasing.”

           “Hey, he said mean things, too.”

           “Yeah, but you always knew when he was purposefully being mean.  He’s much more blunt than you are, and you know it. You’re super passive aggressive when you want to be.”

           “I—I am,” Seokjin sighed.  There was no use denying it.  “So,” he said after a moment, twirling Namjoon’s hair between his fingers.  He should dye his hair before they left. “Was I a dick?”

           “Yes, Seokjin.  A lot. You two were terrible for and with and to each other.  You know this.  He knows this.  We’ve been over this.  Why the renewed interest?”

           “Just what Y/N said, about how I should apologize to him.”

           “Jin,” Namjoon said seriously, rising up to stare down at Seokjin.  Some of Namjoon’s stares Seokjin loved.  He loved when Namjoon would get all soft-eyed when he looked at him.  He would stare like no one would notice.  He blinked slowly as if he didn’t want to miss anything Seokjin did.  He would get serious and stare when he wanted to pay attention and let Seokjin know he mattered.  He would sometimes, though, give Seokjin a look that Seokjin knew all too well.  It was the you-know-you’re-wrong-but-I-think-you’re-capable-of-admitting-it-yourself-before-I-tell-you look.  Seokjin wasn’t a fan of this one.  It made him squirm and groan and grow embarrassed and a little bit angry even if Namjoon was right.

           “You never apologized?”

           “I don’t remember saying any of that!  It was years ago!”

           “Jin.  Jin,” Namjoon said softer.  Seokjin risked looking at him, and thankfully the look was gone, replaced by something a little sadder.  “You know how Yoongi never forgets, like, anything.”

           “Unfortunately, I do.”

           “So, if you remembered, would you apologize?  If you could, would you say it again?”

           “No.”

           “Then apologize.”

           “Even if—”

           “Even if,” Namjoon said, putting his head back on his own pillow and pulling Seokjin into his chest.  He let himself be moved until no one’s arm was being slept on and felt himself grow sleepy again as they both settled down.  Still, he waited until Namjoon’s little snores rumbled through his chest again before he closed his own eyes, already running the conversation with Yoongi over and over in his head.  There was no way to come out on top of it, but Seokjin never really cared about beating Yoongi or being better than him.  He already knew, in many ways, that he was.  In other ways, Yoongi would always be superior.  Seokjin could admit that.  He could admit that he was wrong, too.  And if that helped Yoongi to be happy, truly happy, happy like he never was with Seokjin, then Seokjin was more than willing to help that happen.

           Hoseok sometimes felt bad for his neighbors.  He wasn’t exactly what one might call a quiet person, but he figured that his positive energy and friendliness balanced out.  Everyone knew him even if he couldn’t remember their names, and on more than one occasion someone had knocked on his door asking for help to move something or find a cat or “borrow” sugar or something, and he was always more than happy to oblige.  So he didn’t feel an ounce of remorse as he and Tae tramped up the stairs as loud as a horde of elephants.  He wasn’t ashamed at how they were laughing as loud as hyenas, either, as they stumbled into the walls while he fumbled to open his door as Tae leaned on him and tried to catch his breath.

           To the untrained eye, the pair would surely look drunk.  And Hoseok felt a little lightheaded, but, not to be cheesy or anything, he was just high on happiness.  Not high.  That word made him think of actually getting high, which he had only done once, or, tried to do, but had promptly fallen asleep after taking one hit.  So, not high, as he didn’t know what that felt like, but light, floaty, almost, like he could just fly away by how carefree he felt. Which is saying something, because Hoseok is almost always carefree.  But tonight, tonight, he’s just, he’s just.  He doesn’t know.  He’s happy. That’s all.

           Happy, to see his best friend so happy, happy, to see how two lives can merge together, happy, to know everything was only going to get better from here, happy, to have Tae coming home with him.

           He was happy at how Tae had changed since they actually started talking about their relationship more—I know, what a concept, doi.  He was happy by how much closer they obviously were because of it—wow, who would have thought talking could do that?  He was happy with finding little bits of Tae all around his apartment, even if he usually liked keeping things extremely clean.  He was happy with the way Tae was catching onto his mood and he was getting better at reading Tae’s.  He was happy that they could touch, and did touch, almost all the time wherever they went.  He was happy to know Tae didn’t shy away from such displays and actually wanted them himself. He was happy, even if he would never by the man’s soulmate, to be with him.

           And, if he was forced to admit it, he was happy with the sex, okay?  It was intense in all the right ways.  Tae was intense.  He sometimes got this look on his face that almost scared Hoseok, and he had jumped and screamed a little in surprise—he’s man enough to admit—on more than one occasion when Tae randomly bit him or spanked him without any precursor. And he had gone still, too, which is pretty impressive considering how much he is always moving, more than once when Tae suddenly touched him like he was made of glass or whispered so softly in his ear how much he loved him.  He loved those moments, all of those moments, because, if nothing else, Tae kept Hoseok on his toes, and even if he thought he had seen and heard everything from the man, he continued to be surprised and impressed.

           The first time Tae had said “I love him,” though, Hoseok hadn’t necessarily reacted as one might hope or expect.  He’d, well, uh, accidentally flailed a bit and elbowed Tae so hard in the ribs he had a bruise the next day.  There had been a lot of squawking, if Hoseok remembers correctly, and profuse apologizing even though Tae laughed it off like he did most things.  In hindsight, Hoseok has been able to laugh about it, too, and is fine with Tae teasing him over and over again by warning him beforehand he’s going to say it or covering his chest awkwardly and obviously before he says it.  It never seems to take anything away from the moment, though.  Love, in Hoseok’s mind, is often too serious.  Or people try to make it so.  The movies have an epic swell in the music when someone finally confesses.  It’s pouring down torrential rain as if it’s suddenly a life or death situation.  The words are said and suddenly everyone is crying and gnashing their teeth and pulling out their hair because finally, finally someone loves meeeeee!

           Love should be carefree.  Light. Happy.  Hilarious.  And full of awkward human moments.  So Hoseok loved how much Tae and he laughed even when trying to lose themselves in the throes of passion.  He loved how gross morning breath was when they kissed.  He loved how Tae would sputter when Hoseok introduced him as his boyfriend to random strangers who definitely did not ask.  He loved how they still fumbled to undress each other and laughed when one of them tried to be “too sexy” and couldn’t stay in character for whatever nonsense they had planned.  He loved that they were figuring each other out, what they liked and disliked, what they needed and wanted, what they preferred and could endure. He loved each opportunity to get to know Tae more and to grow closer to him, and he knew Tae felt the same.

           So, stumbling into his apartment and kicking off their shoes—that he would fix later into neat little rows when he got up to pee or get a glass of water or something because he’s not OCD but shit, there’s no need to be so flippant when it comes to a little order in one’s house—really felt like coming home. Pulling on each other’s belt loops and smashing a little too hard into the kitchen counter on the way to the bedroom so Tae could suck on Hoseok’s neck—an action that sounds ridiculous and even humorous, as Hoseok first thought, too, as he laughed when he tilted his head back, but, as always, he started to get warm and wanted to pull Tae closer the second his lips were on him—was commonplace, so much so that Hoseok never left anything glass on any countertops or tables anymore for fear of breaking something in the middle of making out.  Trying to race each other to the bedroom and see who could undress the other first—Hoseok always, always won, and he’d like to think he’s just that good with his hands, but Tae seemed to let him win every time because Hoseok had figured out that secretly Tae like having someone else peel his shirt off and pull his pants down and leave him there to shiver for a few seconds—seemed like second nature at this point.

           And, on most nights, pulling each other into bed and roaming all over each other and never letting the other go would be expected.  It was hard to resist each other when they were in full display for the other, standing or sitting or lying there in waiting, inches and inches of tan skin waiting to be touched and kissed, to be worshiped and loved.  It was what Hoseok expected, even, because something about going to a wedding always made him remember how much he loved love, and he loved Tae.  He told him as often as he could.  Loved how Tae seemed to have no trouble saying it to him but still blushed a little when Hoseok reciprocated.  So to take him to bed and, as someone more crass might say, have his way with him, seemed like the most viable option, like the right choice.

          But he slowed down once Tae was naked before him. They were always too busy to be bothered with any lights, but even in the darkness, Hoseok could see him.  He knew how strong he was beneath his soft layer of skin.  He knew how kind he was even when he had a mischievous glint in his eye.  He knew how hard he worked to help others and yet how much he loved, at the end of the day, when he was tired or overwhelmed, being taken care of.

           And Hoseok didn’t know, could never know, what it must be like to see your soulmate get married to someone else.  If Tae and Jimin were anyone else, he figured it would have broken Tae.  So even though he knew the two soulmates loved each other, and he knew Tae supported Jimin and always would, he imagined Tae might be a little hurt even with how much he smiled and danced and laughed at the wedding.  He knew he might be feeling a little lost and left out and inadequate and lonely and incomplete and hopeless and scared and worried about his own future.  He might, just might, if Hoseok is feeling extra brave to consider, have been looking to Hoseok so much the whole day for reassurance. He might have been watching him to try to catch a glimpse of something, some spark of hope that one day it might be them getting married.  And Hoseok would be damned if he wasn’t going to do everything he could to make sure Tae had nothing to worry about, to make sure he knew he was loved and valued and appreciated and enough, more than enough.

           “I’m going to take care of you,” Hoseok said firmly even though it came out as a whisper.  It must have surprised Tae, whether because he always seemed a little surprised when Hoseok said such words or because the change in speed and volume of everything gave him a little whiplash, because he grew still and quiet, so Hoseok waited as he took his hand until Tae nodded before leading him to the bathroom.  He smiled at him as Tae stood with his hands in front of him, waiting while Hoseok filled up the bathtub until he got cold or couldn’t wait any longer and wrapped himself around Hoseok, leaning against his back while the sound of water rushing calmed him down.  He went willingly once Hoseok helped him step in and watched with not an eager or excited eye but a look of admiration and appreciation as Hoseok finished undressing to get in behind him.  He melted a little into Hoseok’s chest and a little more as Hoseok ran his hands all over him, but Hoseok didn’t feel any less light or carefree or, for lack of a better word, high.  If anything, he felt more-so.  The more Tae relaxed into him, he more at ease he felt.  They fit together perfectly even if they weren’t “destined” to be.  And since there was no hurry, because Hoseok was going to be there when Tae woke up in the morning, he was going to be there even when Tae lost his cool a little and got impatient and snapped at him over something minor, he was going to be there even when Tae needed his soulmate more than he needed a boyfriend, Hoseok took his time on Tae.

           He washed him carefully, making sure to get off all of the smells that didn’t belong to him.  That weird Aunt Sally and friend-of-a-friend who had danced a little too closely and someone’s cigarette smell and something else Hoseok couldn’t pinpoint that definitely wasn’t Tae or him—or Jimin or Jungkook or Y/N or Yoongi, the only other smells he would allow.  Tonight, he wanted Tae to smell like Tae, and a little like him, because he’s a human with a tiny trace of possessiveness in him as we all have.  Hoseok wants him to know that he’s his.  So he washed him carefully and completely, and he patted him dry and wrapped him up in his softest robe that Tae had once made fun of but now tried to steal every time he was over.  And he held him before they could even brush their teeth, even before he could get either of them dressed apart from the furry robe, and just let them breathe together, closing their eyes before sleep came.  Eventually, he helped Tae get dressed in Hoseok’s flannel pants and into bed where he slid in next to him and pulled him close and just stared at him until Tae’s eyelids started to flutter.  He kissed him, then.  On his hair and forehead and cheek and chin and nose and eyelashes and temple and knuckles and neck and chest and ribcage and stomach and collarbone and everywhere he could reach, saving his lips for last.  He took his time.  There was no hurry.  No rush.

           He would kiss Tae until he fell asleep, and Hoseok would keep kissing him until he fell asleep himself.

           Ducking out of one’s own wedding may be a little frowned on, but Jimin had moved past what other people thought years ago.  Besides, they had only invited people who wouldn’t be so judgmental and petty, and everyone was still having plenty of fun when he pulled Jungkook away.  It hadn’t taken long to read Jungkook’s uncomfortable cues, anyway, and he had learned early on that Jungkook was an introvert unlike himself and Tae and Hoseok. Honestly, he was surprised the boy could keep up with the three of them so well, but he supposes it was just a testament to how much he liked them all.  Still, Jimin could tell when his smiles shifted from genuine happiness to politeness, and that was when he knew it was time to go.  He had kept the boy as close as possible all night if only to give them some semblance of their own personal bubble when really everyone wanted to be in their space.  It was to expected; you invite people to a wedding to share the experience with them, but Jimin could tell Jungkook was getting exhausted, and even though the boy protested, actually daring to complain about proper decorum or some ridiculous shit no eighteen-year-old would normally say, Jimin dragged him out, anyway.

           He was flushed from dancing or from happiness or from embarrassment, Jimin wasn’t quite sure, but either way the boy looked good, and he was his now.  The idea made him pause and consider the boy sitting so close to him in the car on their way home.  Jungkook had the ability to be giggly and breathtaking one moment and teasing and sultry the next, and if Jimin wasn’t so confidence in himself, it might confuse and intimidate him, but it only made him feel more endeared to the boy.  He hadn’t ever felt like a very possessive person; protective, yes, fiercely so, but having Tae as a soulmate had always meant he shared everything he could with everyone he could.  It was simply their nature, and Tae brought out a side in him that made him want to simply give and give to others as much as he could.  So the idea of having someone to himself, even though he knew he didn’t own Jungkook, it was nothing like that, was new and, frankly, a little overwhelming. He had fleeting thoughts of Tae throughout the ceremony and even now, thoughts he had to gently push aside.  He was doing nothing wrong, and while he and Tae could share Jungkook in other ways, now wasn’t the time for that.  He was to have Jungkook like Tae never could, like Hoseok never could, like no one else ever had and no one else ever could.

           “Jungkook,” he found himself saying, suddenly overwhelmed with the thought.  He knew the boy was nervous even if he wanted it. And for weeks Jimin hadn’t been nervous but had wanted to wait.  He couldn’t let Jungkook know he was nervous now for fear that the boy would misread his hesitation as repulsion or a lack of desire.  If anything, he simply wasn’t sure how to handle how much he wanted the boy. He wanted him to laugh and smile and squirm and moan and sigh and beg.  He wanted all of him, whatever that looked and felt and sounded and smelled like.

           And the boy just looked at him, sweetly and expectantly with a touch of anxiety that Jimin wanted to kiss away.  So he did.

           And Jimin was used to being graceful.  Tae had always been a little clumsy, had fumbled and gotten overly excited and eager the few times they had done anything that crossed the border of platonic friends, but Jimin had always been calm and collected, cool and in charge. It was expected of him, as a dancer, in some way, to remember how to breathe and know the placement of his hands, to remember the moves, of when to push and when to pull, of when to go fast and when to go slow, so while he stumbled up the stairs and stumbled into their apartment as Jungkook clung to him and tried to wrestle him out of his clothes, he regained his composure once they made it to their room that was definitely theirs now, no longer just Jimin’s.  Jungkook seemed to be seeping into Jimin’s space and Jimin’s being already, and if the desperate noises coming from Jungkook’s mouth were any indication of how effected he was, too, then Jimin knew the boy just wanted to be close to Jimin as much as possible.  

           Still, he found it in himself to slow down, to hold the boy, to touch him all over.

           “Jungkook, Jungkook,” he said somewhere between their shirts on and their skin bare. “I’m yours.”

           “And I’m yours,” Jungkook almost whined back, capturing Jimin’s lips to shut him up, but Jimin wasn’t done, so he let the boy kiss him for a moment before pulling him back.

           “Now and always,” he said seriously, staring into the boy’s eyes.  Jungkook’s eyes were wide but they softened a little as he stared back at Jimin, repeating the words he might as well have tattooed on his brain by this point.

           “No matter what the world says.”

           “Until the world ends,” Jimin continued.

           “Or my soul stops,” Jungkook breathed, taking a deep breath and resting his forehead against Jimin’s.

           “You have me now and forever,” Jimin said, trying to sooth him while touching him all over all at the same time.  “So there’s no hurry.  You love me?  You trust me?”

           “I love you,” Jungkook almost sobbed.  “I trust you.  Now touch me.”

           “Calm down,” Jimin almost laughed, but he touched Jungkook, anyway.  He was touching him, and he would keep touching him. He could touch him anywhere now, so he would.  “We have all night.  We have all our lives.”

           “That’s real nice,” Jungkook sighed again before grabbing Jimin again.  “But I want you right now.”

           “Okay,” Jimin laughed, pushing the boy back onto their bed and climbing over him even as he peeled off his pants and followed with his own.  “You have me.  Now and always, okay?”

           “Okay,” Jungkook whispered, staring up at Jimin.  He had a bit of nervousness left in him, something easily read as a desire to please and do well.  Jimin had no doubts he would.  The kid was annoying good at everything he set his mind to, and while Jimin might have the upper hand tonight for the boy’s first time, he had no doubt that Jungkook would be a fast learner and would be giving Jimin a run for his money in no time. For now, Jimin was going to savor how eager and willing he was.  He was going to take his time, spend as much time as Jungkook could stand, was going to test his patience and stamina.  And it would take time, to learn what Jungkook liked and didn’t like, but Jimin could be patient, clearly more patient than Jungkook could be.  He would learn what made the boy preen and blush, and he would enjoy every second of it.

           “Jungkook,” he said, trying to keep his voice steady when he just wanted to laugh and blow raspberries all over his hardened stomach, “husband.”  Jungkook’s breath hitched a little at that, which made Jimin smile wider.  “Mine,” he whispered, watching Jungkook nod and reach for him.  “Love,” he tried, smiling even more when Jungkook closed his eyes for a second before opening them, his pupils wide and glistening.

           “Soulmate,” Jungkook said firmly and decisively, pulling Jimin down until he was almost being squished.  He mouthed at Jimin’s earrings and the side of his neck, anything he could reach until Jimin pushed himself off and properly kissed him.  “Please,” the boy managed when Jimin left his lips again to make his way down his body.  Jimin knew Jungkook could be a brat, so his politeness was sure to fade if Jimin tested him much longer.  He decided to go easy on him for now.  He would probably go easy on him the rest of their lives, if he was honest.  He’d give and give and give anything and everything that Jungkook needed or wanted.  For now, that was himself, as much and as quickly as possible.  So, with one final kiss to Jungkook’s navel that made the boy twitch a little under him and made Jimin smirk a little above him, he gave the boy what he wanted, but moreover, he gave him what he needed.

           Relationships, like life, have many stages.  The infancy, with fleeting glances and blushing cheeks and stammered confessions and thumping hearts and sweaty palms.  

          The childhood, of whispered secrets and loud laughter and shared interests.  

          Adolescence, the wild abandonment and wild dreams and stolen kisses and promises made.  

          Adulthood, when things became serious and mature, the settling down, the label and symbols of love, the inability to keep your hands off of each other, the desire to show them off and declare your love to everyone you met, the swelling of hearts like nothing else, the belief that nothing could go wrong, that everything was perfect.  

          And middle age, when things either grew boring or you settled into a pleasant rhythm.  When the mundane and monotony of living together and knowing what the other was thinking or doing without even needing to communicate brought despair or contentment.  When simply being with the other was enough or wasn’t.  The time when a crisis happened or the last push toward peace and security for the rest of your life settled in.  

          And, unfortunately for some, death, the end of everything you once held dear and thought would never end.  The uncomfortable silences and broken hearts and prolonged absences that turned bitter until they burnt.  You had never experienced such a stage in any relationship and hoped you never would.  You knew Yoongi had, though, and you wondered, though the idea was quickly squashed, if he was thinking about if things would ever end that way for him again.  They wouldn’t, because you weren’t Jin or anyone else.  You weren’t just somebody for him.  You weren’t sure what stage your relationship was in with Yoongi, but whatever it was made you feel alive and terrified all at the same time.  He seemed to continue to have that effect on you.  You wanted more and yet were afraid of taking too much, of taking something that wasn’t yours.  Even if you knew deep down that he was yours, even if you had spoken those very words out loud before, something still held you back.  You wondered, after listening to Jimin and Jungkook make promises to each other to complete each other and be there for each other, if you could fully give yourself to Yoongi while feeling like he would never fully be yours.

          Perhaps there was no reason to ask that question, because you already knew the answer, but you were determined to try.  You were insistent on trying to prove to him, to show him, to make him believe you and trust you.  Your actions and words hadn’t been as clear as his had been, and you didn’t want him to have any doubts that you wanted to stick around, that you wanted to be with him and by him and as close to him as possible.

          If that was pathetic, then Yoongi was right, and you were pathetic for him, but he merely had to look at you for know that he was gone for you, too.  So you tried to push aside all of your insecurities and invasive thoughts that weren’t of Yoongi and Yoongi only as you got back home.

          It was home.  Some part of you knew this and believed this.  Felt it to be true as you toed off your shoes to pick up and carry to the closet as Yoongi went to get a couple of glasses of water.  You knew his place was home by the flowers that always seemed new in the vases spread around the house.  They were, if nothing else, the answer for your earlier question. Because flowers, like relationships, also go through the stages of life.  And the jasmine scattered throughout Yoongi’s house were always thriving.  You never saw one of them wilt or die.  You knew they had to; there was nothing magical about them.  But Yoongi never let them got to that point, or at least never let you see them.  And it was almost silly, really, you, who worked in a flower shop and knew every name of every flower and every meaning behind them, to step into Yoongi’s room that was now also yours and to stop and simply stare at the flowers by his bed, finally realizing where the two of you stood.

          It should have been easy, then, to turn around and just tell him or show him when he came into the room and looked at you just standing there, but you felt like you could barely breathe much less speak or make sense of whatever you were feeling.  Perhaps you were getting easy to read, or Yoongi was always that intuitive or aware of what you needed before you had even acknowledged him, because he put the glasses down and reached tentatively for your hand, tugging you toward the bathroom with no sense of urgency.

          “Brush, wash,” he said, handing you your toothbrush as he proceeded to do the same, his eyes barely leaving you in the mirror as he did.  You watched as he brushed his teeth, rinsed, and spit before you even moved to do the same, blinking away your stupor that he might be registering as sleepiness. You felt anything but sleepy, though. You felt wired and jittery, twitchy, even, and your fingers were shaking a bit as you tried to brush.  By the time you finally were done, you stood up to Yoongi holding a face wipe in front of you, and you closed your eyes for him to step close and do it for you.  You couldn’t help grabbing onto his wrist, the contact alone making you sigh and calm down a little as he pressed gently but firmly around your eyes and cheeks to remove your makeup, more than you were certainly used to wearing.  When his hand left you, you opened your eyes to see his face much closer than it was before, and you scooted a little closer, wanting to simply melt into him, but his hand came back to your cheek to steady you, and you kept your eyes open to look up at him even though it was difficult. Your eyelashes kept flickering, and your eyes seemed to be blurry and unable to focus, but all you wanted to do was look at Yoongi looking at you.  You needed to watch him watching you.  You had to see the way he looked at you, because no one else looked at you like that.  No one else ever had, and no one else ever would, surely.

          “Yoongi,” you managed to say as his thumb and fingers glided across your face and neck.  He just continued, his eyes never leaving yours until you practically nuzzled his hand, breaking eye contact with him only to kiss his palm once before looking back up at him.  “Please.”

          “Can I?” he said, even though he didn’t need to. Still, the question made you move, pulling on his belt loops as you nodded.  No one had ever asked before, and even though he could probably read your mind at this point and must surely know what you wanted and needed more than anyone else ever could or ever would, he had still asked.  You could laugh at him later, because kissing for the first time in a bathroom didn’t sound much better than kissing in an elevator, but Yoongi had been right.  There was really nothing to compare.  You weren’t sure if you had expected to literally melt or explode, so you were glad neither of those happened.  You were glad you didn’t start shaking more to the point of throwing up or itching to the point where you would bleed if you scratched too hard.  You were glad you only melted a little as your lips merged together.  You were glad you only shook a little when you felt his fingers twitching against you before they pressed into your skin.  You were glad, and glad couldn’t even begin to describe it—relieved? Grateful? Satisfied?—when Yoongi finally kissed you.

          Like everything else he did, he moved slowly but surely.  Once he knew he had permission, he didn’t hesitate.  He controlled your every movement without being forceful.  And he left you wanting more, so it felt extremely rude and unfair when he pulled away from you, laughing as you tried to chase him.  He ducked down to your neck, though, which didn’t surprise you.  He had staked his claim to that territory weeks ago, so it was naturally his favorite spot.  Wanting to give to him as much as possible, then, you let him until your fingers started to twitch again, itching for a chance to do the same to him.  He seemed to notice your plight and chuckled again before taking both of your hands in his and leading you back into the bedroom, flicking off the light as you went.

          The darkness that engulfed you was a little too much, and one of Yoongi’s hand left yours to turn on the lamp that illuminated first and foremost the flowers underneath them before even revealing his face.

          “Yoongi,” you said again, looking between the flowers and him.  He hummed as he let go of your hands, and without even asking permission you finally started to unbutton his shirt.  With something to do, your fingers seemed to have stopped their fidgeting, and his plain but offensive shirt was soon undone, and he let you push it down his arms until it fluttered to the ground.  His undershirt had to go, too, and he lifted his arms easily as you tugged it up and over his head.  You had only seen him shirtless a few times accidentally.  He had always been extremely modest around the house, always making sure to at least have a shirt and shorts on around you, even though you had always figured he would prefer to be wearing less clothes, especially to bed. You had never really ogled at guys before.  You hadn’t had girl friends growing up to gossip about boys with or giggle and point out who you thought was hot.  You knew Yoongi was fit and attractive, but his looks had never been what made you desire him.  It was how he acted and treated you, and, honestly, how he sounded when talking to you, that made you attracted to him.  So his smooth, lean torso was momentarily distracting, but it was the expanse of skin that mattered no matter what it looked like, and you splayed a hand over his chest almost experimentally.  Yoongi was not ticklish, you had discovered a while ago, though he did have sharp reflexes and would retaliate if poked in his side surprisingly. So when he barely even flinched when your fingers touched him, you weren’t surprised.  Pleased, even, that he was letting you touch him.  You figured he would let you do anything to him, but still, you were used to having things done to you, not the other way around.  Exploring your partner simply for the sake of exploring was a pretty foreign concept to you, and you could tell you were always losing your footing.  So you did what you thought you were good at and went for his pants’ button and then zipper, and he let you, only stopping you when you tried to pull them down his hips.

          “Hey,” he said softly, his voice making you stop and stand up completely.  His pants fell on their own accord, and he stepped out of them before running his hand up and down your forearm.  “I told you I’d be good to you, right?”  Nodding slowly, you felt yourself shiver, because you couldn’t quite comprehend what he could mean.  

          “Let me just,” he sighed, pulling you toward him and kissing you again.  If that’s what he meant by being good to you, then he could keep doing that and you would be perfectly content and happy.  His kisses seemed to be a distraction technique, though, and a clever one at that, because you barely noticed his hands unzipping your dress and pulling the material off of your shoulders and down your arms until the cool air hit you, causing you to shiver again.  You could tease him later about not even taking advantage of the dress’ slip, but at the moment you had to hold onto his shoulders, his bare shoulders, which was a new sensation, as he moved toward your neck again.  The familiar movement of his nose over your delicate skin was soothing, though, and helped counter balance the new sensation of his hands running all over your bare back.  Yoongi’s hands were soft, never calloused, because the man was the biggest softie you had ever met, and you knew Jimin and Tae.

          It fit his character, then, that he continued to move slowly and carefully all over you.  That he placed himself on the bed first instead of pushing you down into it. That he never let go of your hand and always made sure you were connected in some way.  It made sense that every kiss he placed on every inch of skin he could reach lingered longer than the last.  That he took his time and checked on you and listened to you and asked you constantly with his eyes or his words if you were okay or if you needed something. It made sense that he insisted on always facing each other.  To anyone else, he might have appeared vanilla or even lazy, but for you, and to you, there was nothing more intense about the way he looked at you, about the way he touched you, about the way he kissed you.  Good couldn’t even begin to describe how he made you feel, and your panting breaths and curled toes and sweaty limbs had hardly anything to do with why, when you insisted that he had to stop before you cried from how overwhelmed you felt, you somehow felt even closer when he curled around you and simply held you as you fell asleep, discussing the wedding and the night and what tomorrow would bring.

          It was this growing feeling inside you that even without vows, even without being able to smell him, Yoongi was never going to leave you or let you go, and even if people called you pathetic, you knew you were never going to let go of him, either.  And even if you couldn’t tell him that, even if you didn’t know how to say exactly what you were feeling, Yoongi must have known, because he turned over and dragged you with him until you were both facing his nightstand where the vase of jasmine still sat, glowing even in the otherwise dark room. It was so much more than a mere flower, and it was so much more than a mere feeling that you had about Yoongi. Still, you knew it was only going to grow, and nothing could ever make it wither or fade or die.

A/N:

OKAY, FIRST!

Let me just say a few things.  I don’t even know where to start.

Why does HOSEOK keep stealing the show?  He is amazing.

Okay, here is Jimin’s suit and Jungkook’s.  You’re welcome.

I decided that Jungkook’s flower would be the peony BEFORE I even knew he was going to end up marrying Jimin.  I swear.  So I liked bringing it up for this chapter and explaining why the flower fit his character.  AW.  Boy giviing Jimin a flower?!  UGh.  And their vows? UGh.

Also, where my singles at?  Is it just me, or do you also have mixed feelings about weddings?  They can be so depressing or so exciting. I don’t know.  Lots of mixed feelings there.  Y/N just wanted to be next to Yoongi.  “What are we, 12?”  Seriously, these kids.

This part: “ he said so slowly and calmly and yet so clearly on the edge of desperation—for what? for you?  or for you?—” has two meanings–is he desperate for you (like he wants you) or for you (like he’s feeling for you).  Hopefully that makes sense.

I wanted to show our four relationships to represent the different stages of relationships, in a way.  Seokjin and Namjoon are happily together, have been forever, are in that “mundane” part where things are purely comfortable being together.  Hoseok and Tae are moving toward that–they’re past the “let’s just have sex all the time” stage and moving into real love.  Jimin and Jungkook are literally newlyweds now, hitting their honey moon stage.  They’re gonna, YOU KNOW, a lot now.  And Yoongi and Y/N are FINALLY getting their act together, admitting their feelings, talking things through, KISSING YES.  So that’s that.

Also, Y/N and Yoongi got so domestic, oof.  But I think it fits their characters, like Y/N kind of explains.

I love comments etc. as always!  Enjoy!
trail.content_abstract:
Summary:  Being unable to smell wouldn’t matter if you were anyone else in a completely different world.  For you, it means you don’t–can’t–won’t ever find your soulmate.  So is it any wonder that you don’t believe the guy who one day insists you smell like jasmine?  

A/N:  I’M ALIVE!  After three weeks of crazy work, gross depression, and being sick, I finally got to write some.

HOWEVER, there were a lot of intimate scenes I wanted in this chapter, and I found that I just couldn’t write those well or quickly, ugh.  So, while this is THIRTY-FIVE pages, it’s still not what I was expecting.  Oh well.  Also not super proof-read, so may edit it later, but you’ve all waited so patiently, so I wanted to get something out! Enjoy!

It’s the wedding chapter!  Please see ending notes for more info.

I am aware that this gif is NOT a peony, sad day.

The italics in this story are Y/N’s thoughts or past dialogue.

Warnings: Some bad words. Underage drinking (Don’t do that!  It’s overrated!)

W/C: 16,613 (!)

Masterlist

15. Dogwoods

16. Peonies

“It starts between two suns
Between dream and sleep
Like a sigh after oblivion
-The way you hold the night.

It goes on in a kiss
So many pains exchanged
Like a song of compassion
-The way you reveal my name…”—Emmanuelle Soni-Dessaigne

          Hoseok loved weddings.  Loved.  Hoseok loved love.  How could he not like weddings, then?  Plus, dancing?  Alcohol? Hot men in suits looking hot? What’s not to like?

summary: Bts reaction to you having a strange addiction
body:
Bts reaction to you having a strange addiction

Jin walked in to your shared room looking for you. because you guys were playing hide and seek. He got down on his hands and knees looking under the bed to find bottles and bottles of deodorant. He pulled them out and saw that some were empty and some had teeth marks. He grabbed one and went searching for you remembering that the game is still going on he walked to the bathroom and opened the door to see you hiding behind the shower eating the fucking Arm pit shit. He jumped into action and grabbed the bottle from your hand scolding you about how bad it is for you.

It was Yoongis first time being over at your house since you started dating. You guys were having a great time and it started to lead to somthing more. His hands started to roam your body and his kissing started to get heavier and deeper. When you suggested to take it to the bed. When you got there he sat up against the head board watching you climb on him straddling. As you were kissing down his neck he looked around the room creeped out with all the eyes staring at him. Hey babe he manged to say. You replied with a hmm. Can you uh hide your creepy dolls first I don’t like them starring at my soul. You busted out laughing and got up to hide the dolls.

You and Hobi were at the store shopping for some stuff when you spotted chalk. You ran up and grabbed like three tubs full of chalk. Hobi just assumed that it was because you do art or something. Once you were done checking out and put the stuff in the car. You grabbed a box of chalk and started eating it. Hobi looked over and saw these and swerved off the road. Wided eye and in horror screaming. YOU DONT EAT CHALK WHAT THE FUCK. he stopped the car and yanked the chalk out of your hands and threw it 0ut the window and made a turn back to the store to return all the other chalk.

You forgot that you had invited your boyfriend over for dinner. So when he walked in he couldnt find you. Hes wondering around the house looking for you. When he came up on a door he’s never been in. He knocked and said your name quietly and poked his head in to see you surrounded by stuffed animals asleep. He smiled and walked into the room and layed down next to you and wrapped you in his arms. You groggily said that he wasnt supposed to find out about this room and he just chuckled and kissed your head telling you it’s cute and suits you. You layed your head back down and both fell asleep in a room full of stuffed animals.

You had knocked over a glass that shattered when Jimin jumped up and told you to step away so you dont get hurt. You laughed and told him that it was fine and started to pick up the glass pieces and stick them in your pocket. He looked at you confused. You explained that it was for later and he just let you be. What he didnt expect was to come home from practice to you chewing on the glass. He picked you up and ran you to the hospital because glass is hurt full and he wanted to make sure you were healthy.

Tae Tae I have a confession you told your boyfriend while he sat on the couch. He looked at you wided eye expecting the worse. but when he heard what you said he busted out laughing. Baby girl having a shopping addiction isnt bad there are worse things he told you. You sighed and pulled him up and showed him rooms and rooms full of toy and clothes all with the tags still on them and everything. He looked around and turned and smiled at you. They still have tags we can return them and the ones we cant we can have a garage sale okay babe for now on let me shop with you so I can help you not buy useless stuff. You smiled and his words and hugged him and thanked him for helping you.

You were chilling with your friend Jungkook. Just asking random questions. When he asked if you had a strange addiction. You looked at him weird like wtf type of question is that. You sighed and went all sad and dramatic saying yeah I have a strange addiction to your face. He chuckled then paused and yelled WAIT IS THAT A INSULT !?!?! You just chuckled and scooted closer to his face almost touching his lips. Saying I dont know maybe. When you stood up to walk off when he grabbed your arm pulling you back down. Well Y/n I think I have a strange addiction to your face as well and he pressed his lips to yours.

summary: [ARTICOLO] Queste teorie su ‘Map of the Soul: Persona’ dimostrano quanto i BTS e gli ARMY siano intelligenti “Quando si...
body:
[ARTICOLO] Queste teorie su ‘Map of the Soul: Persona’ dimostrano quanto i BTS e gli ARMY siano intelligenti

“Quando si menzionano gli ARMY, i fan del gruppo sudcoreano dei BTS, si fa spesso l’errore di ridurli a un gruppo di “ragazzine che strillano”. Questo è un cliché di fatto sessista e che non trova riscontro nella realtà. Inoltre, minimizza il loro impatto. I fan hanno un’organizzazione online e offline al pari di quella di uno staff che si occupa di una campagna presidenziale, hanno donato milioni alla carità, hanno tradotto i contenuti in moltissime lingue – tutto questo guidati dalla passione che hanno per la musica dei BTS.

Ma gli ARMY sono dei veri e propri detective: sono abilmente riusciti a districare la misteriosa narrativa del ‘BTS Universe’ che da anni il gruppo inserisce nei loro video musicali, nelle ‘notes’ scritte in stile diario e inserite dentro agli album, e in altri contenuti. Gli ARMY sono anche veloci a captare i piccoli indizi che il gruppo dà riguardo a ciò su cui stanno lavorando – e non deludono nemmeno questa volta.

La Big Hit Entertainment, l’agenzia dei BTS, ha annunciato che il loro prossimo album ‘Map of the Soul: Persona’ sarà rilasciato il 12 aprile. Questo album darà il via a un nuovo capitolo della discografia del gruppo dopo ‘Love Yourself’, la trilogia uscita lo scorso anno della quale due album hanno raggiunto il primo posto nella classifica Billboard 200.

Gli ARMY hanno già tirato fuori le lenti d’ingrandimento e si cominciano a trovare teorie circa il tema della nuova era dei BTS. E pare che i BTS stessero seminando indizi da molto tempo. Di seguito riportiamo ciò che i fan hanno scoperto fino adesso.

Accenni a “Map of the Soul: Persona” sono stati lanciati per almeno gli ultimi due anni senza che nessuno se ne accorgesse.

I BTS hanno lasciato indizi per la trilogia di Love Yourself durante i Melon Music Awards del 2017. Un anno dopo hanno fatto lo stesso per il successivo capitolo prima dell’esibizione ai MAMA del 2018. “Mi hai dato potere, mi hai dato amore. Quindi ora sono un eroe, un ragazzo con amore”, nel video sembra esserci un riferimento al loro singolo del 2014 “Boy In Luv”. “Ti mostrerò la mappa dell’anima, ti mostrerò il sogno.”

Kim Seokjin, conosciuto come “Jin”, il più grande del gruppo, ha indossato una camicia con la parola “persona” durante l’esibizione di “DNA” nell’ottobre 2017.

Alla fine del video per “Epiphany” del 2018, canzone singola di Jin e introduzione dell’album “Love Yourself: Answer”, compare un testo in coreano che dice “Al finale del viaggio per trovare me stesso, il luogo che ho raggiunto è di fatto dove già ero stato. Alla fine ciò che dovevo trovare, cioè l’inizio di ogni cosa, il traguardo: la mappa dell’anima. La quale è in tutti ma che non può essere trovata semplicemente da chiunque, io ora inizierò la ricerca.”

Il titolo potrebbe essere un riferimento alle teorie di psicologia di Carl Jung.

I ragazzi dei BTS non sono solo belle facce, a loro piace sviluppare idee basate sui lavori di grandi intellettuali e pensatori.

RM, il leader dei BTS, ha menzionato alcuni dei lavori di Haruki Murakami ritenendole influenze artistiche. Il tema dell’album “Wings” dei BTS è stato ispirato da “Demian” di Hermann Hesse mentre alcune parti di “Love Yourself: Tear” si possono ricondurre al libro “The Magic Shop” di James R. Doty. Il consenso generale è che il titolo del prossimo album faccia riferimento a “Jung’s Map Of The Soul” di Murray Stein, libro che la Big Hit sta vendendo da parecchio tempo sul suo sito online.

Lo psicologo svizzero Carl Jung, fondatore della psicologia analitica, credeva che ci fossero quattro principali archetipi della mente umana che componessero la personalità di un individuo: la Persona, l’Ombra, l’Anima/Animus e il Sé.

Jung descriveva la Persona come la nostra immagine pubblica o l’immagine che presentiamo di noi stessi al mondo; la parola deriva da un termine latino che faceva riferimento alle maschere indossate dai mimi etruschi. I BTS hanno incluso le maschere in molti dei loro ultimi lavori, inclusi i video di “Fake Love” e “Singularity” ma anche nel video di introduzione alla loro esibizione ai MAMA 2018. La band ha precedentemente discusso l’importanza dell’autenticità nel loro lavoro, includendo quanto vitale sia non fondere le loro identità di performer con le loro identità di essere umani.

Da qui, gli ARMY sembrano essere divisi sul numero di album che seguiranno in questa serie.

Alcuni credono che, come è stato per la serie Love Yourself, Map of the Soul sarà una trilogia composta da tre capitoli: Persona, Sé e Ombra (unito a Anima/Animus).

Ci sono poi coloro che credono che vi sia un qualche collegamento fra la serie “Love Yourself”, “Map of the Soul”, e più nello specifico le teorie di Jung. “Love Yourself: Her” rappresenterebbe infatti l’anima (intesa come la femminilità integrata negli uomini), dal momento che nei video rilasciati in concomitanza con suddetto album c’erano diverse donne (a rappresentare forse gli alter-ego femminili dei membri). “Love Yourself: Tear”, poiché affronta sentimenti oscuri e repressi, sarebbe invece il simbolo dell’archetipo dell’ombra, e in ultimo “Love Yourself: Answer” rappresenterebbe l’io, per il suo descrivere un viaggio verso l’accettazione e la consapevolezza di sé.

“Map of the Soul: Persona” dovrebbe, dunque, affrontare l’archetipo successivo, ed essere costituito da sette album diversi, uno per ogni lettera che compone la parola [“Persona”].

Con questa premessa, poi, secondo le ipotesi di alcuni, ogni album potrebbe rappresentare uno dei membri del gruppo.

I fan stanno però creando teorie anche sulla possibile collocazione di “Map of the Soul” nel più generale sistema della discografia dei BTS. In “2 Cool 4 Skool”, album di debutto del gruppo, vi è una traccia nascosta, “Path” (N/B: “Percorso”), nella quale i membri parlano delle diverse vie che li hanno portati a diventare cantanti e delle paure generate dalla possibilità di aver scelto la carriera sbagliata. Poiché le lettere iniziali dei titoli degli ultimi album dei BTS formano proprio la parola “Path”, questo potrebbe voler dire che i membri sono ormai definitivamente convinti che questa sia la strada giusta per loro.

Dal suo debutto nel 2013, il gruppo ha sempre creato musica inerente alle sfide e gioie del progressivo raggiungimento della maturità, e l’album che verrà rilasciato ad aprile sembra adattarsi perfettamente, in quanto passo ulteriore verso la crescita, lo scendere a patti con la propria identità e l’imparare ad amare sé stessi, alla storyline che è stata creata fin dall’inizio”.

[ARTICOLO] Queste teorie su ‘Map of the Soul: Persona’ dimostrano quanto i BTS e gli ARMY siano intelligenti

“Quando si menzionano gli ARMY, i fan del gruppo sudcoreano dei BTS, si fa spesso l’errore di ridurli a un gruppo di “ragazzine che strillano”. Questo è un cliché di fatto sessista e che non trova riscontro nella realtà. Inoltre, minimizza il loro impatto. I fan hanno un’organizzazione online e offline al pari di quella di uno staff che si occupa di una campagna presidenziale, hanno donato milioni alla carità, hanno tradotto i contenuti in moltissime lingue – tutto questo guidati dalla passione che hanno per la musica dei BTS.

Ma gli ARMY sono dei veri e propri detective: sono abilmente riusciti a districare la misteriosa narrativa del ‘BTS Universe’ che da anni il gruppo inserisce nei loro video musicali, nelle ‘notes’ scritte in stile diario e inserite dentro agli album, e in altri contenuti. Gli ARMY sono anche veloci a captare i piccoli indizi che il gruppo dà riguardo a ciò su cui stanno lavorando – e non deludono nemmeno questa volta.

La Big Hit Entertainment, l’agenzia dei BTS, ha annunciato che il loro prossimo album ‘Map of the Soul: Persona’ sarà rilasciato il 12 aprile. Questo album darà il via a un nuovo capitolo della discografia del gruppo dopo ‘Love Yourself’, la trilogia uscita lo scorso anno della quale due album hanno raggiunto il primo posto nella classifica Billboard 200.

Gli ARMY hanno già tirato fuori le lenti d’ingrandimento e si cominciano a trovare teorie circa il tema della nuova era dei BTS. E pare che i BTS stessero seminando indizi da molto tempo. Di seguito riportiamo ciò che i fan hanno scoperto fino adesso.

Accenni a “Map of the Soul: Persona” sono stati lanciati per almeno gli ultimi due anni senza che nessuno se ne accorgesse.

I BTS hanno lasciato indizi per la trilogia di Love Yourself durante i Melon Music Awards del 2017. Un anno dopo hanno fatto lo stesso per il successivo capitolo prima dell’esibizione ai MAMA del 2018. “Mi hai dato potere, mi hai dato amore. Quindi ora sono un eroe, un ragazzo con amore”, nel video sembra esserci un riferimento al loro singolo del 2014 “Boy In Luv”. “Ti mostrerò la mappa dell’anima, ti mostrerò il sogno.”

Kim Seokjin, conosciuto come “Jin”, il più grande del gruppo, ha indossato una camicia con la parola “persona” durante l’esibizione di “DNA” nell’ottobre 2017.

Alla fine del video per “Epiphany” del 2018, canzone singola di Jin e introduzione dell’album “Love Yourself: Answer”, compare un testo in coreano che dice “Al finale del viaggio per trovare me stesso, il luogo che ho raggiunto è di fatto dove già ero stato. Alla fine ciò che dovevo trovare, cioè l’inizio di ogni cosa, il traguardo: la mappa dell’anima. La quale è in tutti ma che non può essere trovata semplicemente da chiunque, io ora inizierò la ricerca.”

Il titolo potrebbe essere un riferimento alle teorie di psicologia di Carl Jung.

I ragazzi dei BTS non sono solo belle facce, a loro piace sviluppare idee basate sui lavori di grandi intellettuali e pensatori.

RM, il leader dei BTS, ha menzionato alcuni dei lavori di Haruki Murakami ritenendole influenze artistiche. Il tema dell’album “Wings” dei BTS è stato ispirato da “Demian” di Hermann Hesse mentre alcune parti di “Love Yourself: Tear” si possono ricondurre al libro “The Magic Shop” di James R. Doty. Il consenso generale è che il titolo del prossimo album faccia riferimento a “Jung’s Map Of The Soul” di Murray Stein, libro che la Big Hit sta vendendo da parecchio tempo sul suo sito online.

Lo psicologo svizzero Carl Jung, fondatore della psicologia analitica, credeva che ci fossero quattro principali archetipi della mente umana che componessero la personalità di un individuo: la Persona, l’Ombra, l’Anima/Animus e il Sé.

Jung descriveva la Persona come la nostra immagine pubblica o l’immagine che presentiamo di noi stessi al mondo; la parola deriva da un termine latino che faceva riferimento alle maschere indossate dai mimi etruschi. I BTS hanno incluso le maschere in molti dei loro ultimi lavori, inclusi i video di “Fake Love” e “Singularity” ma anche nel video di introduzione alla loro esibizione ai MAMA 2018. La band ha precedentemente discusso l’importanza dell’autenticità nel loro lavoro, includendo quanto vitale sia non fondere le loro identità di performer con le loro identità di essere umani.

Da qui, gli ARMY sembrano essere divisi sul numero di album che seguiranno in questa serie.

Alcuni credono che, come è stato per la serie Love Yourself, Map of the Soul sarà una trilogia composta da tre capitoli: Persona, Sé e Ombra (unito a Anima/Animus).

Ci sono poi coloro che credono che vi sia un qualche collegamento fra la serie “Love Yourself”, “Map of the Soul”, e più nello specifico le teorie di Jung. “Love Yourself: Her” rappresenterebbe infatti l’anima (intesa come la femminilità integrata negli uomini), dal momento che nei video rilasciati in concomitanza con suddetto album c’erano diverse donne (a rappresentare forse gli alter-ego femminili dei membri). “Love Yourself: Tear”, poiché affronta sentimenti oscuri e repressi, sarebbe invece il simbolo dell’archetipo dell’ombra, e in ultimo “Love Yourself: Answer” rappresenterebbe l’io, per il suo descrivere un viaggio verso l’accettazione e la consapevolezza di sé.

“Map of the Soul: Persona” dovrebbe, dunque, affrontare l’archetipo successivo, ed essere costituito da sette album diversi, uno per ogni lettera che compone la parola [“Persona”].

Con questa premessa, poi, secondo le ipotesi di alcuni, ogni album potrebbe rappresentare uno dei membri del gruppo.

I fan stanno però creando teorie anche sulla possibile collocazione di “Map of the Soul” nel più generale sistema della discografia dei BTS. In “2 Cool 4 Skool”, album di debutto del gruppo, vi è una traccia nascosta, “Path” (N/B: “Percorso”), nella quale i membri parlano delle diverse vie che li hanno portati a diventare cantanti e delle paure generate dalla possibilità di aver scelto la carriera sbagliata. Poiché le lettere iniziali dei titoli degli ultimi album dei BTS formano proprio la parola “Path”, questo potrebbe voler dire che i membri sono ormai definitivamente convinti che questa sia la strada giusta per loro.

Dal suo debutto nel 2013, il gruppo ha sempre creato musica inerente alle sfide e gioie del progressivo raggiungimento della maturità, e l’album che verrà rilasciato ad aprile sembra adattarsi perfettamente, in quanto passo ulteriore verso la crescita, lo scendere a patti con la propria identità e l’imparare ad amare sé stessi, alla storyline che è stata creata fin dall’inizio”.

Traduzione a cura di Bangtan Italian Channel Subs (©Cam, ©CiHope, ©lynch, ©jimindipityR) | ©Refinery29
